column1: After his father's death, thirteen-year-old Herman Melville was forced to find work ___
How old was Herman Melville when he made his first sea voyage as a merchant sailor?
What was the name of the whaling ship on which Melville spent 18 months between 1841 and 1842?
Which American literary figure, to whom Moby Dick was dedicated, influenced Melville's writing?
In what decade did historians rediscover and promote the previously ignored Moby Dick as a seminal work of American literature?
